medical_history.chief_complaint: Retrosternal discomfort, dysphagia, odynophagia, fever, chills, non-productive cough, and diffuse body aches.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 4 days prior to the February 2008 presentation, with the chief complaints of retrosternal discomfort and swallowing issues. There was a subsequent 2-day history of subjective fevers and chills. In October 2008, the patient again presented with a 1-month history of fever, chills, non-productive cough, and diffuse body aches.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Significant for a febrile illness at age 11 that developed while traveling in the Middle East, causing cervical lymphadenopathy and leading to a diagnosis of Salmonella serogroup D after a lymph node biopsy.
medical_history.family_history: Parents are first cousins; no other specific familial conditions mentioned.
